Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJBeenThere
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Rome, we couldn't have asked for a better stay. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. David - front desk - was wonderful and arranged for our pick-up and return to the airport. We were close to the Vatican and other sites. There were good restaurants in the area recommended by the staff and the hotel breakfast was very good. Room was clean and all was very nice. We'd definitely stay again and recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “It's perfect”
Reviews.Author: Iron_Wing
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit Rome and prefer an uncomplicated and nice hotel, go to the Relais dei Papi. The location is absolutely perfect for visiting the Vatican (10 Minute walk away) and all other sights can be easily reached by metro or bus. The rooms are extremly clean, some even don't have carpets (allergies!). The staff is very kind and provides maps, extra information about city and sights and recommends restaurants that are worth visiting. Breakfast varies: sweet Italien styled things, but also eggs, ham, cheese, toast and marmelade, tea and cakes are available. We enjoyed our stay a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Very Nice People Friendly - Rome dont bother”
Reviews.Author: j0hnn0_001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights 17th Mar to 21st Mar 2012 the hotel from the outside is nothing special but looks are deceiving on this occasion, just a door on a back street but once inside the Hotel is pleasant, clean and tidy. Only a continental breakfast and no bar but we prefer to be out and about normally when on a City Break so no problem with that. The Staff were very friendly (in fact the only friendly people we met in Rome) as soon as we arrived the porter gave us excellent information and advice on the city and the people, with a free map he wrote all of the best places to explore, although great advice some of it was a real downer. He warned us that everyone would be out to fleece us, said be very careful of pick pockets and never sit outside a restaurant without know the prices first. This unfortunately left us with a bad taste and did not help our frame of mind as we felt on edge and suspicious of everyone all weekend. He also told us that the taxi trip from the main station should have been 15 euro and not the 40 euro we had to pay! I have to say that apart from a visit to the Sistine Chapel and the Hotel we stayed at The Relais Dei Papi our trip was the worst city break ever. It was very clear that the Italians hate the British, very rude people especially when they knew you were British - we were ripped off at every opportunity with EXTORTIONATE charges for: - Taxi 4 km trip 40 euro!!! 2/3 pint of beer 7 euro! 1 x tea+ 1x coffee+ 2 x pastries + 33 euro!!! A work colleague of mine yesterday told me that he had similar experiences visiting Rome, Venice and Milan on a three City excursion, he was fleeced by everyone at one point with his pregnant wife he had a 2km taxi ride with luggage that the driver wanted 50 euro for!! - the taxi driver would not let them have their luggage until they paid!! This is just my opinion but if you are considering Rome or even Italy THINK AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “a bit confused?”
Reviews.Author: millbury
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay, and this is a great hotel. However, we discovered that the hotel has been extended up to the 4th floor, and everything there is brand new. This is not mentioned on many websites, including this one, and the photographs shown are of the original hotel, with only six bedrooms. Our room was on the 3rd floor, in the old part, which of course we had booked anyway. Our shower was very very small, no good if you are a big bloke, and the toilet seemed to have been converted from an old bidet, with a seat that no-where near fitted in size. However, it was clean, with lots of hot water. The twin beds pushed together to make a double, were very comfortable, and we slept well. Very quiet, the fabric lined walls creating good sound-proofing. Location is brilliant. Get the hop on hop off bus from behined St Peter's Sq, the best way to see everything and very reasonable in price. Only a 10min walk back to the hotel. Lots of good trattoria's etc for eating, within easy walk, and great shops too. Try AI BALESTRARI on Piazza De'll Unita, (behined the hotel) for a really good typical Italian meal with the locals, at a great price. Overall, our stay at Relais dei Papi was very good. Yes, the croissants for brekkie are delicious, and all the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated small and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsRo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small hotel for a 4 day city break and would highly recommend. The staff are particularly friendly and gave helpful advice on sites to visit in the city and where to eat. The room was spacious, clean and very quiet. Buffet breakfast was substantial with plenty of choice. Only thing lacking was a tea/coffee making facility in the room. There are 104 steps to reach the hotel on the third floor (yes we counted them!) but there is a lift if you have had enough exercise walking around the beautiful city of Rome. The hotel is only 5-10 minutes walk to the Vatican, which is worth popping back to at night to see lit up and when the crowds have gone from St Peter's Square. There are a number of relatively cheap places to eat in the vicinity as well as a supermarket in the same street for essentials.

Reviews.Title: “LITTLE GEM!”
Reviews.Author: Adam f
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at this hotel for a two night city break and having trying to find somewhere cheap and of a good standard in Rome, this more than ticked all the boxes! the hotel staff are just fantastic and the decor of the hotel is brilliant. I stay in a lot of hotels and this was brilliant for the price in Rome. book it you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobandbobette
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a long weekend in Rome. The hotel was in a excellent location for shopping and sightseeing. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, which made us feel very welcomed. They were also able to cater for a gluten free breakfast and my partner had a plateful of gluten free toasts,crackers and biscuits every morning. The rooms were clean and also a good size. We would definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved every single detail - We loved Prati area!”
Reviews.Author: xr
Reviews.Content: We visited “Relais dei Papi” last March for 6 days. My first thought was that it is a bit cleistophobic but a few minutes later I got used to it and I couldn’t stop thinking how beautiful this little hotel is! Even thought the walls are covered with fabric the hotel is very clean! Seldom have I seen a hotel with such nice details, wherever you looked you could see a “Nice Touch”. People who own this little “Gem”, as someone else described it, must love it! Breakfast is very nice and not at all the poor “Continental” we expected. You have many options and you can eat as much as you like!! The area is excellent, SAFE and I believe the only area in the center of Rome which is not completely touristic, with Italian people actually staying there! The best, not touristic restaurants we ate are all close to the hotel and there were filled with locals! The Hotel is located 5 minutes walk from “Piazza Cavour” so you can take the cheapest fare from the airport, a bus that costs only 8 Euros and makes a stop at Piazza Cavour”. >>>“Stefanos” Restaurant across the street is great!

Reviews.Title: “Make this your first choice!”
Reviews.Author: simsres
Reviews.Content: Everything is great! Great location near to almost everywhere - the eur8 shuttle bus from airport stops at Piazza Cavour which is within walking distance to hotel, we walk to all the must-see sights plus there is a metro station nearby that brought us to the train station! Great room - super clean and has everything you need. Great service - Daniel gives great directions and recommendations. Everyone is friendly. We always had a hearty breakfast before setting off! Thanks! It was a wonderful stay for us! Cheers Ethan & Jenny from Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: VoicuD
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was really nice and the croissants were great. The hotel was 5 minutes away from the Vatican, and the neighborhood was quiet and clean. There is a general retailer (Billa) in the same building and several other big stores just tens of meters away. The rooms has internet, I could even print something at the reception and there was nothing actually to complain about. The metro station is pretty near, some five minutes walk, with a direct connection to Termini, but there is also a bus connection with the airport in the Cavour square, which is nearby. So, all in all, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel near Vatican city”
Reviews.Author: Dave K
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel walk down to Vatican city air conditioned Friendly staff spoke good English Breakfast Room was small with limited food small bathroom with very small shower

Reviews.Title: “Sight seeing in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rosiefryer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a few exhausting days of sightseeing in Rome. We stayed at this hotel. Its location is great, 5mins walk from the vatican/St Peters Square and lots of good restaurants/pizzerias nearby. Can particularly recommend - Varonne Restaurant - close to the hotel and Ristochicco( Borgo Dio n 186) closer to the vatican. The staff in the hotel were sooo helpful and it was extremely clean and very quiet. The one and only critisism is that it would have been lovely to have a bath in the room to soak our weary legs after all that walking. Apart from that we would def use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: catsarethebest
Reviews.Content: We spent three night here last weekend and the place is great. Our room was newly decorated and absolutely spotless, I've stayed in some very upmarket hotels that haven't been this clean! Breakfast was adequate although the breakfast room is a little on the small side and got a bit congested! Superb location within walking distance of Vatican, restaurants and shops yet tucked away in a secluded street which was quiet and peaceful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Daria P
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Helpful and friendly staff with much better English. The decoration and design of the hotel is excellent. I can recommed this hotel. People were helpful, breakfast was good, location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My Vatican Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rosegomez07
Reviews.Content: I only stayed in Rome for 3 nights just to visit the Vatican. This is a perfect hotel. Within walking distance. Lots of good restaurants around. Billa a grocery store just around the corner. Now this is not a complaint , but the rooms are not to big, and the shower is small, after all the walking I did at the Vatican, all I needed was a BED. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Che bello l'albergo!”
Reviews.Author: Ingham M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two weeks ago. What a beautiful surprise we got. Our room(which i fell in love with) was on the 3rd floor and is Parisian style - very ornate; plenty of room for the three of us and spotlessly clean. Daniele and his team have expanded to the fourth floor which is ultra modern and again spotless. Breakfast is served on this floor and by Aussie standards superb!. The Hotel is close to all the main attractions of Rome - we actually walked to them all no trouble! What made this Hotel extra special is Daniele` and his wonderful staff from the front desk to cleaners and breakfast staff they were so accommodating with tourist information, where to eat and how to get to different places and just all round lovely people. I cant wait to return to Rome & again stay with them. Good place to eat near hotel San Marco Ristorante - il cibo e` molto buono!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Anne521
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just moving into the 4th floor so the rooms were newly renovated and very modern. Very comfortable with a decent continental breakfast. We would have liked a lounge area to relax in but the room itself was very good. We felt very safe at all times - being so close to the Vatican there were plenty of security people around. There were loads of places to eat and the number 81 bus took us from just round the corner to all the major sights. bed was a bit hard.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Small Hotel at a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dudel
Reviews.Content: We really, really liked this hotel, its wonderful helpful staff and its great location. It is a very nice mini hotel, even though it tries to imply the impression of a fancy 4 star boutique hotel (which it is not) and the 300€ rack rate is just ridiculous. That said, if you are looking for good value at a great location, this is your ticket. We paid 80€ per night, which is a fair price for Rome in the summer. The whole hotel (only 6 rooms) is nothing more than a clever converted apartment. Our room was small but smartish. Free WiFi, and a big flat screen TV. Breakfast was appropiate in Italian terms for a small hotel, even though the public space was nothing more than a hallway. We really liked it. The staff is cordial and helpful. The location, even though not in the heart of the city, is great. In Prati, an upmarket neighbourhood near the Vatican. Great shopping high street in close vincinity, metro station 5 min away. Many nice restaurants as soon as you step out of the hotel, a real Roman middle class bario.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: cwalja
Reviews.Content: Great location with exceptional staff. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. We would stay here again if we ever returned to Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting...”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a very small part of our honeymoon (thankfully only one night). The location was great, but that was about all it had going for it. The rooms and bathrooms were the tiniest we've ever seen, and we had to request a decent amount of supplies such as towels (there was only one, even though two of us were in the room), and toilet paper (there were about 5 squares left on the roll, and no extra roll anywhere in there). There was horrible, ornate fabric in blinding colors and patterns all over every inch of every wall and door. The "breakfast" was also terrible - a few packaged pastries and cookies, sketchy looking meat, and cheese in plastic wrap (like kraft singles). The space they had set up for breakfast was really more of a hallway with three tiny tables shoved in - there were only a couple of other people in there, and nobody could get around. We each had a cup of coffee from the machine, and then immediately ran out of there to find somewhere decent to eat. We couldn't wait to get out of there and move on to our next location, which was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: The_Shizniz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of July 2011, and I was very impressed with the level of service given by the staff at the hotel. I was warmly welcomed on arrival by Daniel, who was at the reception each night of my stay, and was very friendly and always will to help with any question I had. He also went the extra mile to recommend restaurants and shops to visit while I was there in order to avoid being ripped off by the tourist hot spots. The hotel was very well situated, just one block down from the main road, so it was quiet, and a couple blocks walk up to the Vatican City. It was also a 5 minute walk to the Metro, which made getting around very easy. The hotel was very clean, and was attended to each morning. The rooms were not the largest, and were strangely decorated, but I wasn't there to sit in my room all day. The only issues I had were the size of the shower, which was quite small, so it was a struggle to turn in the shower, as well as the comfort of the bed. The bed was not the most comfortable matress in the world, but it served it's purpose. Each room also had free wi-fi, which I have found very rare in many European hotels. Each room does have a mini bar, with drinks inside, but I found these to be expensive (but no more expensive than in a restaurant), and the hotel has 2 local shops less than 100m from the front door where you can buy things at a third of the price and stock your own fridge. The hotel was very reasonable in price, and suited my purposes perfectly. I have no complaints, as who goes to Rome to sit in your hotel room anyway. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone planning a trip to Rome, especially if you are looking at budget and value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: 08langosta
Reviews.Content: We booked this location for our honeymoon, and this little hotel is really cute, very ornately decorated and just about a half mile from the Vatican! We wanted to be within walking distance for an affordable price and this was a good match. The bathroom is quite small compared to what we were used to, the shower was really tiny and hard to use. They serve a continental breakfast, with sliced meats, cheese, toast, croissants and packaged snacks. The staff was very helpful with everything, from the room to getting around the city and recommendations on the bus schedule and restaurants/delis. Though it was small, I really liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, quiet and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Poodles2Go
Reviews.Content: I can echo what most others have said. Our room was very clean and VERY quiet - kudos to the Relais for their soundproofing. Also, we had shutters on the windows so we could keep the room dark if we wanted to sleep a little later. The shutters are made so you can cover the windows but still keep the windows open - we loved this feature. The bathroom was very small, but everything was there to make our stay comfortable. There was a nice armoire instead of a closet, with extra pillows and blankets We had a shower stall with sliding doors - if you are a big person, this is a bad option for you, as the doors don't open that wide. Also, the hairdryer is pretty much useless, but we found this in other hotels, as well. Bed was very comfortable - breakfast was adequate, supplemented with yogurt and hard-cooked eggs, cheese and meat available. There is a coffee machine, but the staff will make espresso on request (I didn't bother). The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and spoke English - good news for us. A few blocks to the Metro. There are some decent restaurants in the vicinity. Neighborhood is quiet. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic welcoming stay”
Reviews.Author: watts_peter
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?!! This Hotel is only a few streets from Lepanto metro station and only a 7 minute walk away from the vatican. Very easy to get to from the airport and their website tells everything you need to know and do. The lobby and lift feel and look like you are entering an apartment block. The hotel is on level 3. We were greeted by friendly staff who showed us our room. Which was very clean and tidy, and everything you would want from a hotel room. Very comfortable. We could of chosen room service for breakfast but chose to eat in the area provided which is small but quaint. Great selection of breakfasts including toast, cheese, meat, ceral. When we left for the night we found when we came back from a cold outdoors the hotel staff had put our aircon on to warm our room up which was a really nice touch. Staff were extremley friendly and gave us fantastic recommendations on places to eat and directions to areas we wanted to go. They made us feel very special and gave us undivided attention. Even looked after our suitcase after we had checked out and went sightseeing. Also provided a plug for our electricals as we had left ours at home! We felt extremley safe while staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected delight in a delightfully quiet part of Rome but within easy reach of the main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Patonga59
Reviews.Content: Although the word "hotel" is a bit ambitious our stay here was delightful. Our room (the twin) was small and the bathroom even smaller, but the warmth of the welcome and the friendliness of the staff was outstanding. Breakfast was basic. Several nearby restaurents were a delight and we could reach most attractions reasonably easily on foot. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and lovely, location !”
Reviews.Author: RapeTuke
Reviews.Content: Just returned and want to go back right away! Lepanto metro station just a few blocks away if your feet get tired of walking. Lots of buses as well on Cola dei Rienzo and closer to the metro. I had booked a shuttle bus from Fiumicino via Internet, it was 38 euros for two and worked out fine. We walked everywhere and everything felt close.-someone else on Tripadvisor recommended San Marco restaurant, thanks for the tip by the way- yes- worth every penny, it is so popular, though , even on weekdays that you have to go early ( 7pm) . If you are into leather goods try Ibiz near Campo dei Fiori, via dei Chiavari, or Bottega del sellaio on via bianco s . spirito. Wonderful service and the bags are made there as well. Not the highest fashion but unique and good quality. As for relais dei papi, it couldn't be closer the Vatican or any other major sights, yet very quiet location, in a real Roman block, no tourists, no beggars no problems. If we should make one complain it would be the bread in breakfast! don't eat it! Just run downstairs to the supermarket (opens at 8 and then the entrance is on via paolo emilio round the corner, the entrance through Coin department store opens at 10) and get fresh bread etc. and come back, it takes about 3 minutes and makes your breakfast more enjoyable. The ever so lovely breakfast ladies will make you fresh espresso or cappuccino if you don't like the coffee machine. SInce there really are just three tables for two, you have to schedule your breakfast to get a seat, or you can just ask for a tray to take into your room .This is not a major problem, there are only 8 rooms so it is not really crowded anyway. There is also a janitor in the building ( since there are a few offices) who is very helpful and speaks good English. He is guarding the front door downstairs in the mornings- and thus making you feel safe , too. There are a few steps to the elevator so if you have severe walking disabilities it might be a problem alongside the actual elevator which is the cute but narrow old- fashioned type. The room has everything you need, just remember turn the heater on, well, not too many drawers either if you have packed your whole wardrobe along.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, but far away from subway”
Reviews.Author: William_USA09
Reviews.Content: This is not a big hotel. Rather, it has 10-15 rooms and locates on the 3rd (or 4th) floor of a building. The room is clean and large. Air-conditioner works well (we stayed there in August). Free breakfast. There is a small supermarket right besides the hotel which is quit convenient. The only thing is that it is a little far away from the subway station (4-5 blocks, 20 minutes waking).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: crazysox4
Reviews.Content: This hotel/B&B is fantastic. I agree with an earlier review that it's a bit of experience in itself... the rooms were a little over-the-top in the decoration department, but they were incredibly clean. The staff was EXCELLENT, particularly Diana. She always had an answer to our questions, and we always willing to make confirmation calls, look things up for us, etc. As has been previously stated, breakfast left a little to be desired, but at least we got something! The location was awesome. Because the Vatican stands between the hotel and the rest of Rome, you can't help but walk by it every time you leave and come back to the hotel. I can't imagine going to Rome and only seeing St. Peter's once! It was in a nice neighborhood, and there was a supermarket very close ,so we went and got snacks/water to keep in the room as well. That's a big recommendation I have - if at all possible, get water at a supermarket, because you can get a 6pack for less than 2 euros, whereas if you buy it from a vendor it's going to be more like 6 euros for 1 bottle... The closest thing I have to a complaint is that the front desk isn't staffed overnight, and nobody gets there until about 7:30am, and since the hotel is on the 3rd floor of an office building, nobody can get in the front doors unless buzzed in. This is a good thing, obviously, except that our transfer to the airport for our flight home was to pick us up at 7:20am. They ended up getting there more than 20 minutes early (again, a good thing) but we had no way of knowing because no one was at the front desk to answer their buzz at the front door. Luckily they waited for us! All in all, if I go back to Rome (I threw my coin in Trevi Fountain, so hopefully someday!), I will definitely be staying at Relais dei Papi. Between the staff, location and price, you just can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jcassarino
Reviews.Content: The Relais Dei Papi was a great hotel. It was close to the Vatican/Vatican Museums, which was great for our trips there. It was also within reasonable walking distance to the Metro, which made getting to other sites like the Spanish Steps and the ruins relatively easy. The service was great, and the people were some of the friendliest that we met in Italy. There was breakfast every day, and there were many restaurants in the area that were more reasonably priced than the ones by the more major attractions. It was very reasonably priced, and if we return to Rome, I would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “An experience. Clean and central.”
Reviews.Author: dappleguard
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a good and safe location in Rome with fairly easy walking access to both the Vatican and the city centre. It it however a quite unusual hotel with it's fabric covered walls and a bit of an experience in itself. Rooms are impeccable but the breakfast nothing special. A big plus for the free WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's small... but it's clean, and it's affordable”
Reviews.Author: Jazzmn74
Reviews.Content: When looking for places to stay in Rome, I was amazed at the prices for hotel rooms. Most hotels were in the $500 to $600 a night range, and this was simply beyond our budget. I was unfamiliar with the neighborhoods, and therefore, somewhat concerned that less expensive places were somehow in less desireable neighborhoods. The reviews for this little place set my mind at ease. Now that I have been, I can safely assure other travelers that this B & B (as it's not at all a "hotel" in the conventional terms)... is located in a wonderful little neighborhood. The local cafes are less expensive than in the heart of the city (and some of the best food we had), the Vatican is less than a 10 minute walk, it's safe, and it's as clean as any other part of town. You have to cross the river to get into the city (a 10 minute walk), but from there, everything is within walking distance. If you are of the mind to take taxis, resist... they are pricy, and the buses and trains are right there (no need if you ask me either, as walking is the best way to see it all). The B & B is the 3rd floor of a nice building, but it is small, a bit on the "overdecorated side", and small (did I mention small). None of this will matter, as your room is merely a place to rest your head, and your weary legs. What you will find, is that it is clean, and quiet, and that will be enough to make it a comfortable place to rest. Be aware that there is a lift, but it, like our dear B & B, is small (seems to be a theme here), and a bit tricky with large suitcases. My husband found it charming, so it depends on the way you look at it. A minor fact, given you'll only need to negotiate it twice with your bags. The staff was friendly, if also, a bit confused about bookings (didn't realize we were booked for 2 nights at first). They aren't there in the early morning (odd), so no one was there to check us out. There is a tiny little breakfast nook, with pastries, crackers and machine coffee (not bad). Overall, I would recommend this place to travelers who don't want to spend a mint on accomodations, and for those who like to explore. A few tips on Rome; try not to schedule your trip to the Vatican and the Colisseum in the same day (we did), and you won't have enough time to explore the museum if you're worried about getting all the way across town in the same day. Get up early and get to the Vatican Museum. Spend as much time here as you can, but don't expect to see it all. Avoid the early morning line for the Basilica, as you will see it at the end of your day in the museums without having spent the morning in the sun, on a never ending line. Eat on the outskirts of the city. Less expensive, less touristic, and much better food. Try not to go to the restaurants in the English guide books, unless you want to eat with a bunch of other, loud, complaintive, Americans. Do the audio tour at the Colisseum, as you can move ahead of the lines, and you'll have a bit more insight into what you are viewing. Watch out for pick pockets around all the major sites (we saw one in action at the Pantheon). Drink lots of wine, eat lots of pasta, and HAVE a wonderful time!! Book at this establishment for less, and you'll have more to spend on the other stuff. You'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED Relais Dei Papi”
Reviews.Author: mbechard
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed three nights at Relais dei Papi. We just loved it. It was well situated near the Vatican/St Peter's between two Metro stations. The staff was so friendly and helpful and the room was comfortable and meticulously clean. Even the glass chandelier pieces had not a single speck of dust on them. Breakfast was great each day (typical Italian pastries and breads), but the seating space is limited. We were always first to breakfast, so we had no problem, but I think larger groups had to judge their timing. We booked through Orbitz, so got a very good deal, and I will look for Relais dei Papi again if I am ever fortunate enough to return to Rome. I highly recommend it for those who appreciate a small, boutique style hotel that is well run, and well staffed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel815
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The room we stayed in was a triple and had enough room for 3 of us and our luggage. The shower was very small, but nonetheless, it was a good shower. It was within walking distance of the Vatican. The breakfast consisted of breads, coffee, sweet rolls & juice, but that was all we needed to start our day. I highly recommend this hotel, as our experience was fantastic. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “the best accommodation i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: christie28
Reviews.Content: the hotel location is great because it is next to vatican and far from bad neibourhoods like termini...also at 300 metres there are bus stop and metro. also if you like walking its like 15 minutes walking to navona campo di fiori etc Nico and his staff are wonderful and really helpful the hotel is very clean and rooms are really large for a european hotel the best experience i have ever had in europe ihotels s surely in relais dei papi!!! we really felt like home when staying there (so safe and so quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Lower than a luxury B&B”
Reviews.Author: Sharon_hot
Reviews.Content: The location looked so-so with small elevator and the breakfast was horrible (not fresh pastries but industrial). For a "luxury bed and breakfast" it was a scandal ! If you want a luxury bed and breakfast, skip !

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clttravelor
Reviews.Content: A super little hotel very close to the Vatican,the staff is great, willing to help out with dinner suggestions,cabs or what ever you need. No problem with their english. The rooms are small (especially the shower) but the are so clean that you over look the size. The hotel is more like a bed & breakfast in a nice neighborhood with good places to eat & shop, it may be a little hard to find but worth it! I would stay here again & suggest it to any one who wants to be out of the hustle of the typical tourist locations. A great value in Rome, we felt very safe in the neighborhood and could walk to many places. Don't look for fancy views from the windows but if you are looking for a very clean place to stay at a good price with helpfull staff and comfortable beds this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Beautiful Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChicoWexford
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the internet and was impressed But when I got there I was more than impressed. It is a sweet little hotel about 1 mile from St. Peter's, 8 rooms on one floor, 3 floors up. Therefore, quiet. Beautifully decorated small bedrooms, warm and inviting, bathrooms small, all new fittings. Breakfast was more than adequate. All in all, I would strongly recommend Relais dei Papi to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Olandea
Reviews.Content: We [A group of four singles] stayed in the Relais Dei Papi for three nights last month. It was a delightful place to stay. While it is small, 8 rooms on the third floor [there is a lift !] it is clean, very central with friendly accommodating staff. A continental breakfast is served in a "compact" dining area, however the food offered is standard and the overall satisfaction experienced diminished the rather tiny eating space. The decor is quite unusual giving a cosy ambience. Air-conditioning will keep you cool or warm depending on the time of year.The bathrooms are very modern. An excellent base for the Vatican and surrounds. We would not hesitate to stay there again.
